qas.question: When did the Adana massacre take place?
How many Armenians died in the Adana Massacre?
When was the Armenian Reform package introduced?

context: The Ottoman Empire began to collapse, and in <a3_0>1908<a3_0/>, the <a4_0>Young Turk Revolution<a4_0/> overthrew the government of Sultan Hamid. In <a0_0>April 1909<a0_0/>, the Adana massacre occurred in the Adana Vilayet of the Ottoman Empire resulting in the deaths of as many as <a1_0>20,000–30,000<a1_0/> Armenians. The Armenians living in the empire hoped that the Committee of Union and Progress would change their second-class status. Armenian reform package (<a2_0>1914<a2_0/>) was presented as a solution by appointing an inspector general over Armenian issues.
